isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - VEHICLE FEATURES - Standard Features

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Governor Control
svcsubproc.para: DT 466E and INTERNATIONAL® 530E engines are electronically controlled for all operating ranges.

svcsubproc.title: American Trucking Association Data Link Provisions
svcsubproc.para: Vehicles are equipped with the American Trucking Association (ATA) data link connector for communication between the ECM and the Electronic Service Tool (EST).
The ATA data link provides data for the following:

item.para: Production line programming of vehicle features

svcsubproc.title: Service Diagnostics
svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Service Tool (EST) provides diagnostic information using the ATA data link.

Diagnostic Trouble Codes for sensors, actuators, electronic components, and engine systems are detected and stored in the ECM. The ECM transmits Diagnostic Trouble Codes to the EST to indicate correct diagnostic action. The ECM also provides service diagnostic information, via flash codes emitted by the engine warning lamp located on the dash of the vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Speedometer and Tachometer
svcsubproc.para: The engine control system calibrates vehicle speed to 157,157 pulses/mile. The new speed calibration information must be programmed with an Electronic Service Tool.

The tachometer signal is generated by the ECM by computing the Camshaft Position Sensor (CMP) signal. The signal is transmitted to the instrument dash cluster and the Electronic Service Tool (EST) by the ATA data Link.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Over Temperature Protection System (Coolant Temperature Compensation)
svcsubproc.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation reduces fuel delivery if engine coolant temperature is above the cooling system specifications. Fueling is reduced proportionally to the design limit exceeded. Fuel reduction is calibrated to a maximum of 40% before standard engine warning or optional warning/shutdown is engaged. If warning, shutdown, or Coolant Temperature Compensation (CTC) occurs, a Diagnostic Trouble Code is stored in the ECM memory.

note.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation may be omitted on emergency vehicles that require 100% power on demand.

svcsubproc.title: Event Logging System
svcsubproc.para: The event logging system records engine operation above maximum rpm (overspeed), high coolant temperature, low coolant level, or low oil pressure. This information and readings for the odometer / hourmeter are stored in the ECM memory and may be accessed using the EST.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Crank Inhibit
svcsubproc.para: Engine Crank Inhibit will not allow the starting motor to crank if the engine is running or the automatic transmission is in gear.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Accelerator Pedal
svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Accelerator Pedal eliminates the mechanical linkage used with conventional accelerator pedals. An accelerator position sensor, part of the accelerator pedal assembly, provides the ECM with an analog voltage signal representing the driver's demand for power.

svcsubproc.title: Cold Ambient Protection (CAP)
svcsubproc.para: The Cold Ambient Protection system safeguards the engine from damage caused by prolonged periods of idle at no load during cold weather conditions. CAP will also improve cab warm up.

CAP maintains engine coolant temperature by increasing the engine rpm to a programmed value when the Ambient Air Temperature is below 32°F (0°C), the Engine Coolant Temperature is below 149°F (65°C), and the engine has been idling with no load for more than 5 minutes.
CAP is standard on all trucks without an Idle Shutdown Timer, with a clutch switch (manual transmission), or a neutral safety switch (automatic transmission).

svcsubproc.title: Change Oil Lamp (COL)
svcsubproc.para: The change oil lamp interval can be programmed with the Electronic Service Tool (EST) for milage, hours, or gallons of fuel used.
The change oil lamp timer can be reset with the Engine Diagnostics switch. Set the COL timer as follows:

step1.para: Depress and release the Engine Diagnostics switch twice.
Depress and hold the Engine Diagnostics switch for three seconds.

note.para: The procedure must be done within 10 seconds.
